lines.content: * The main class for the CuddleCare application.
* This class is responsible for initializing the application,
* setting up the parser and commands, greeting the user,
* and running the main application loop.
/** Symbol used to prompt user input. */
/** Parser used to convert user input into commands. */
/** Map of available commands keyed by their string representation. */
* Starts the application by initializing commands,
* greeting the user, and entering the main loop.
* Prints a greeting message to the user.
* Continuously reads user input, parses it into commands,
* and executes them until the application is terminated.
* Prints the input prompt to the user.
* Initializes the available commands and registers them with the parser.
* The main entry point for the CuddleCare application.
* Represents a command that can be executed with optional arguments.
* All commands in the application implements this interface
* Executes the command with the given arguments.
* @param args the arguments passed to the command, may be empty
* Wraps a {@link Command} along with its arguments.
* This class allows the parser to separate command execution
* from parsing input, storing the arguments for execution later.
/** The arguments associated with the command. */
* @param command the underlying {@link Command} to execute
* @param args    the arguments to pass to the command when executed
* Executes the underlying command using the stored arguments.
* The {@code exec} parameter is ignored because arguments
* are already stored in this object.
* A command that exits the application.
* When executed, this command prints a farewell message and
* Prints a farewell message to the console and exits the application.
* @param args ignored; ByeCommand does not use any arguments
System.out.println("Bye bye, Have a wonderful day ahead :)");
* Parses user input strings into {@link Command} objects.
* The parser maps command names to command objects and can
/** Map of available commands keyed by their string representation. */
* Sets the available commands for this parser.
* @param commands Map of command names to their corresponding {@link Command} objects
* Parses a user input string into a {@link Command} object.
* If the input is empty or the command name is invalid,
* prints an error message and returns {@code null}.
* @return A {@link CommandWithArguments} wrapping the corresponding {@link Command},
*         or {@code null} if the input is empty or invalid
private final ByteArrayOutputStream outContent = new ByteArrayOutputStream();
